channel.title: Port forwarding - will pay if you help make it work!
channel.description:
[B][COLOR=red]Anyone who can fix this problem will get $5[/COLOR][/B]. I guess its a problem with no-ip or something. So I can connect to my server fine, I have my no-ip in my client. Now when my friend tried to connect, he cant. Portchecker says the port is open. When I use my external IP on no-ip it says nulls disconnect on my runserver.bat, so I tried to use my internal IP on no-ip and it just automatically changes back to my external IP. I portorwarded using my internal IP if that makes a diff...
Internal IP: 192.168.0.100 External IP: 24.67.70.181
I changed my no-ip to my internal IP instead of my external IP because when the no-ip was set to my external IP, I couldn't connect. I portforwarded my internal IP and port 43594 is open.
My portforward: [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/2e0n3gj.jpg[/img]
And my no-ip I tried to set up with my internal IP, it works but then it automatically changes back to my external...: [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/15rgwwi.jpg[/img] Changes back to [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/30kaa01.jpg[/img]

item.title: Port forwarding - will pay if you help make it work!
item.dc:creator: @Imnotokkk Imnotokkk
item.description:
@Imnotokkk wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:6, topic:365613”]I used to host on my D-Link, so it is possible.

@OP, Are you sure the IP address you put in matches your IPv4 Address?[/quote]
I’m not sure, but all of the stuff that has to do with IPs is posted above with what IP I entered where. Logikscape.no-ip.biz is the one in my client.

Read full topic

item.title: Port forwarding - will pay if you help make it work!
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

Lol Also… Does your friend have windows 7? If so the client wont work unless you change the “run client”
Because my friend was hosting my server for me and he had d-link and windows 7 and he couldn’t log on but I could…Then I changed his run and it worked

Read full topic

@Celeron wrote:

Haay Imnotokkk
I have a bad message for you!

D-Link cant host RS-PS i had D-link befor i got my W-lan router!
You have to buy a w-lan router to host a rsps but they arent so expensive! and you can use them in much different categories!
